Overfitting occurs when a machine learning model is too complex, memorizing the data rather than learning from it. It can be prevented by reducing the model's complexity and using techniques like cross-validation.
Overfitting is the term used when the amount of data is too large for the model to handle, leading to slow processing times. It can be prevented by using a more powerful processing unit.

Overfitting refers to a scenario where the machine learning model performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data because it has not been trained long enough. It can be prevented by increasing the training period.
Overfitting happens when there is insufficient data for model training, resulting in a model that cannot generalize well. It can be prevented by gathering more data.
